developer: JDS Development Group, Major Food Group
description: A 259-unit tower with prices from $1.6M to $11M, excluding penthouses. The building will include a private club and food, beverage concepts operated by Major Food Group
A 1.5 million-square-foot project with a 31-story tower and 46-story tower on 1.2 acres. The towers would share a one-story lobby, 11-story garage and pool decks on the 13th and 31st floors.
A proposed 80-story condo tower to be built on church property. The developer has yet to purchase the land - a parishioner opposes the deal and seeks to block its passage.

Gazit Globe’s U.S. subsidiary, Gazit Horizons, wants to develop the 643-foot tall — or more than 50-story — Brickell Gateway tower on a half-acre lot steps from Metrorail and Metromover. Gazit Horizons bought the property in 2017 for $29.5 million.
An 80-story condo tower with 400 units and two multifamily buildings. The apartment buildings would have 850 luxury units. Mast paid $103 million for the site in December.

A 1.6-acre property and planned site for a three-tower residential and marina project. One tower would have branded luxury apartments and the other two branded apartments. Hernandez paid $50.5 million for the site in September.
OKO Group isOKO Group is led by billionaire Vlad Doronin, which broke ground on the project in 2020 and launched sales in 2018.

A 1.5-acre, ongoing construction project for a 752-foot-tall tower. Last year, the Miami City Commission unanimously approved a resolution designating the site as a brownfield due to heightened levels of arsenic. The designation allowed the developer, Michael Stern, to pursue state tax credits and grants from the federal EPA. Part of the development agreement with the city includes building a fire department on the ground floor. Stern paid $23.5 million for the land in 2020.

Plans for the 4-acre property call for three branded Baccarat towers. A 57-story, 77-story, and 82-story tower, each with hotel, office and retail components. Related paid $104 million for the site in 2013.

A pair of St. Regis-branded condo towers designed by Robert A.M. Stern Architects totaling 354-units. The Depart of Housing and Urban Development released the existing building from its affordable housing agreement last summer.

Continuum South Beach developer Ian Bruce Eichner joined TSG Group and its partners to build a 70-plus story condo tower where a commercial building currently leased to the Consulate General of Mexico is.

Habitat Group has three towers either planned or under construction. The first two towers — Smart 1 and Smart 2 — are 95 percent and 5 percent completed according to Santiago Vanegas, CEO of Habitat Group. The first tower is expected to be delivered in the third quarter of this year. The second tower is expected to arrive in the fourth quarter of 2024. Both will have 100 units. The final tower will have 113 units and is expected for delivery in the second quarter of 2025. Sales for the third tower are already complete. Tower 1 is 95 percent sold and Tower 2 is 80 percent sold.
